actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to eliminate the present inequity that prevents self-employed individuals with maximum earnings, in a year in which the earnings base increases, from ever receiving full credit for such earnings.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends Title II (Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to permit self-employed individuals whose taxable years do not begin on January 1 to use the calendar year for computation base year purposes.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to eliminate the present inequity that prevents self-employed individuals with maximum earnings, in a year in which the earnings base increases, from ever receiving full credit for such earnings.
